meanings.definition: To emerge or flow out from a narrow or confined space.
meanings.sent1: The river was debouching into the vast ocean.
meanings.sent2: After heavy rainfall, the water started debouching from the clogged drain.
meanings.sent3: The excited puppy kept debouching from its tiny doghouse.
meanings.sent4: The students debouched from the classroom after the final bell rang.
meanings.sent5: The colorful confetti debouched from the burst balloon, creating a festive scene.

meanings.definition: To discharge or empty into a larger body of water.
meanings.sent1: The stream debouched its contents into the lake.
meanings.sent2: The sewage system was debouching waste into the river.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing trash can debouched its contents onto the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: The factory debouched pollutants into the atmosphere, causing environmental damage.
meanings.sent5: The melting glacier debouched a stream of water into the valley below.

meanings.sent1: The debouching of the river created a beautiful waterfall.
meanings.sent2: We witnessed the debouching of the creek into the larger river.
meanings.sent3: The sudden debouching of the balloons surprised the party guests.
meanings.sent4: The debouching of emotions during the heartfelt speech moved the audience.
meanings.sent5: The debouching of colors in the painting added depth and vibrancy to the artwork.
